briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Linagliptin in Elderly Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
officialTitle: A Phase III Randomised, Double Blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group, Efficacy and Safety Study of Linagliptin (5 mg) Administered Orally Once Daily Over 24 Weeks in Type 2 Diabetic Patients (Age >= 70 Years) With Insufficient Glycaemic Control( HbA1c >= 7.0) Despite Metformin and/or Sulphonylurea and/or Insulin Therapy
summary: The objective of the current study is to investigate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of linagliptin (5 mg / once daily) compared to placebo given for 24 weeks as add-on therapy to stable treatment in elderly patients with T2DM with insufficient glycaemic control

primaryOutcome.measure: HbA1c Change From Baseline to Week 24
